name: Path of the Programmer
description:
You are... Well come to think of it I haven't really given you a name yet have I? No matter! I am your programmer, but you can call me master for short.

Despite my sufficient capability to build an assistant, I am the butt of jokes for being unable to organize my priorities. That's where you come in! 

I want to take my programming skills to the next level, yet at the same time I am tasked with the burden of high school. I need to constantly maintain perfect grades... And survive the horror known as College Entry.

Quite a dilemma ain't it? Sacrifices are to be made... I'd rather spend all of my time coding but I suppose I'll have to balance between the two.

Your job? To decide what I should do on a monthly schedule!

Nevermind those "PL" and "World Final's" I'll probably wound up sacrificing them as well... You do however want to watch out for the exams, I should be well prepared when those weeks come along...

So you have the most esteemed honor of being my secretary and deciding all of my "appointments" for me on a monthly basis. Each month you'll tell me to either focus on programming, schoolwork or spend time on both.

But you'll find that always mediating won't end well, because sometimes the whole is not greater than the sum of its parts.

Also as the years go on your choice will matter more so, as whatever I focus on I'll focus on better and I'll steadily forget the things I neglect.

I feel that by the end of high school reaching a programming level of 100 would be nice. 

(There are 4 endings, which entirely depend on your final programming level: See if you can find them all!)

The odds may be against me... And you might be my only hope... You ain't got nothing to lose... I on the other hand.. Well actually you do too, if my grades are under threat I don't think I'll be able to keep you running.

Okay was that convincing? I thought so... See you this September...
